variants.Description in input context: Nonsense mutation causing premature termination of translation, leading to loss of PINK1 protein function.

Material used.Description: Comparison of mitochondrial respiratory activity, respiratory control ratio, and ATP production between patient and normal fibroblasts.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: complete loss of PINK1 protein function
Readout description.Result Description: Significantly reduced mitochondrial respiratory activity (20% lower than controls), decreased respiratory control ratio (30% lower), and impaired ATP production via glycolysis.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent patient samples and three normal fibroblast samples.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal fibroblasts used as positive control for respiratory function.

Basic negative control.Description: Control samples with no added substrate used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test for multiple comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Respiratory control ratio ≥ 1.5 and mitochondrial respiration ≥ 50% of controls

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Respiratory control ratio ≤ 1.0 and mitochondrial respiration ≤ 30% of controls

Material used.Description: Quantification of cytochrome c levels in mitochondrial fractions using Western blot.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: complete loss of PINK1 protein function
Readout description.Result Description: Cytochrome c levels reduced by 60% compared to normal fibroblasts, indicating impaired mitochondrial function.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent patient samples and three normal fibroblast samples.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal fibroblasts used as positive control for cytochrome c levels.

Basic negative control.Description: Control samples with no added substrate used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test for multiple comparisons.

Material used.Description: Measurement of reactive oxygen species (ROS) levels using DCFH-DA fluorescence assay.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: complete loss of PINK1 protein function
Readout description.Result Description: ROS levels increased by 40% compared to normal fibroblasts, indicating oxidative stress.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent patient samples and three normal fibroblast samples.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal fibroblasts used as positive control for ROS levels.

Basic negative control.Description: Control samples with no added substrate used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test for multiple comparisons.
